name: Oil-free Wheat Laddoo/Laddu and Choorma - Sweet Wheat cardamom balls. Vegan recipe
description: These Oil-free Wheat laddoo are soft and delicious. Make them with any other whole grain flour or make Atte ka Choorma crumble. Vegan Indian Sweet Vegan, Dairy-free, Soy-free. Use a gf flour to make gluten-free.
recipeIngredient: 2 Tablespoons ground raw sugar (reduce to 1 if you dont like very sweet laddus, or powdered jaggery or sweetner of choice)
2 Tablespoons Maple syrup (you can try agave or date syrup or any sticky sweet syrup or single thread sugar/jaggery syrup)

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, dry roast the wheat flour on low heat for 25-30 minutes, stirring every 3 to 4 minutes. You can also roast over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes. Stir frequently (2-3 times per minute) to avoid burning. Slow roasting however has better flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, dry roast the wheat flour on low heat for 25-30 minutes, stirring every 3 to 4 minutes. You can also roast over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes. Stir frequently (2-3 times per minute) to avoid burning. Slow roasting however has better flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the wheat flour gets lightly browned and you can smell the roasted aroma, add in the ground sugar, cardamom and almond flour and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the wheat flour gets lightly browned and you can smell the roasted aroma, add in the ground sugar, cardamom and almond flour and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the maple syrup, mix well and take off heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the maple syrup, mix well and take off heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water on the mix 3-4 times mixing continuously with the spatula and pressing a little to see if a few lumps are formed.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water on the mix 3-4 times mixing continuously with the spatula and pressing a little to see if a few lumps are formed.

recipeInstructions.text: Let it cool slightly till easy to handle, then knead it using you hands for a minute, so the nut oil and the maple incorporate well and help with the sticking.
recipeInstructions.name: Let it cool slightly till easy to handle, then knead it using you hands for a minute, so the nut oil and the maple incorporate well and help with the sticking.

recipeInstructions.text: You can serve this lumpy mix, similar to the wheat choorma as is, or make balls/laddoos out it.
recipeInstructions.name: You can serve this lumpy mix, similar to the wheat choorma as is, or make balls/laddoos out it.

recipeInstructions.text: You can add roasted or raw chopped nuts and raisins to the mix. (dont add too many if making balls)
recipeInstructions.name: You can add roasted or raw chopped nuts and raisins to the mix. (dont add too many if making balls)

recipeInstructions.text: Use a spray of water or 2 more to make balls if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a spray of water or 2 more to make balls if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Consume same day or store in airtight container in refrigerator for a few days.
